website_summaries.verdict: This grip is a good replacement for the grip that comes with your system. It is very affordable, and slightly larger than the original.
pros: A larger size makes it more comfortable for adult hands
Rubber grips make it feel like a real controller
cons: The left-joy con sometimes sticks going into the grip

website_summaries.verdict: An affordable option to turn your Joy-Cons into a single, larger controller.
pros: Features rubber grips that make it comfortable to hold
Joy-Cons slide into the grip easily along the rails
Available in multiple colors and designs
Can be used by both kids and adults
cons: Those with larger hands might find this a little small

customer_reviews.title: Prefer it over original!
customer_reviews.text: This grip is a little larger and fits better in adult hands. It's more ergonomic than the original and fits a little more comfortably. Kids shouldn't have an issue with it either since it's smaller than most other controllers. Will buy again if I purchase another set of joy-cons, but it's unlikely at $80 a pop.
customer_reviews.author: Corey H.

customer_reviews.title: Price definitely makes it worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I like the way the grip feels more than the Nintendo brand ones. For whatever reason the left you joycon has trouble sliding in, but not really a big deal. The rails are plastic instead of metal, but that doesn't seem to be much of an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Makes a difference.
customer_reviews.text: Update - After using the switch for 3 months I have determined that this larger-than-stock grip does make a significant difference for my larger hands. While the kids seem to do fine with either, I always use this over the included grip. I find my hands fatigue much slower using this one. Worth the low price tag for adult hands. This grip is slightly wider and and the holds slightly larger than the one included with the Switch. I find myself using this while playing Zelda over the standard grip. Not a huge difference but enough to recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Christian B.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be fooled, complete garbage compared to the original
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, PowerA should be totally ashamed and voluntarily recall every one of these. It may look like the authentic Joy-Con Grip, but it isn’t. The design, comfort, aesthetics, construction, and materials of this unit are all vastly inferior. I don’t know what sort of idiot decided to put those flattened “supports” on the back, nor the useless and uncomfortable lightly textured plastic, but those combined with the more bulbous handles make this thing basically unusable compared to the original Nintendo Grip. The only reason I’m giving two stars instead of one is because the product arrived in one piece and technically does work.
customer_reviews.author: Bob "Mad Bomber" Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and compatible
customer_reviews.text: After the one that came with our Nintendo Switch disappeared, I came to Amazon to find an affordable replacement. I decided to go with this one and ordered the red so it would stand out and be less likely to get lost. It works fine. The original is slightly more comfortable to hold and one side is a little more difficult to get out, but not too bad. We did end up locating our original under a car seat, but because of the bright color, my children still choose to play with this one at times.
customer_reviews.author: In My Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Joy Con slips out on one side occasionally, otherwise fine
customer_reviews.text: This comfort grip gets the job done, but on one side, the Joy Con slips out every now and then. We don’t have that problem with our official Nintendo brand comfort grip, so I know it isn’t a problem with the Joy Con. I guess it’s a matter of you get what you pay for. It’s not problematic enough that we are going to buy another one - yet, as our family isn’t serious gamers, we are more recreational so if someone is playing Animal Crossing, for instance, it’s not a big deal if it slips out.
customer_reviews.author: KDF

customer_reviews.title: Great grip! No regrets!
customer_reviews.text: Love the grip, it’s perfect for long playing. For the price, you really get a great deal. Comes down to preferences, but for me, this has a better grip due to the rubber texture they add. Comes out a bit wider than the original, but once again, this grip feels better to use than the basic sleek one that I had from before. If you see the pictures I submitted, Top one (right in side view picture) is the one that i love (Zelda decal is my own) the bottom is the Nintendo brand. This one is bigger, has a rubber grip underneath and comes out wider for natural grip feel.
customer_reviews.author: GR86

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: It works alright, but there is some quality issues, it's not even close to the level of quality of the grip that comes with the switch. The right joy-con goes in very easily, and comes out very easily. However, the left joy-con is very difficult to get in, and even harder to get out. It feels like plastic grinding against itself and takes a lot of force to remove the left joy-con. I thought mine might be a fluke, and returned it and bought this one again, only to have the new one have the same exact problem. I'd skip on this.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: good spacing, nice grip, but all plastic
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say. We're a Switch family. This review is from all 4 of us. Pros: * Hand placement is great for both kids and adults (slightly wider than the one that came with the Switch) * Nice grippy feel (better than the smooth plastic feel of the OEM) * Solid slide and click-in even though the tracks are plastic (we'll see if this changes over time) Cons: * Ledge under the shoulder buttons is invasive (not sure why the design has this ledge, but it's takes away from the feel) * Plastic tracks (not metal like the OEM) Overall, it gets the job done. It's does what it suppose to...just not fancy.
customer_reviews.author: tech_dad

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This joy con comfort grip does look slightly different than the one that came in the original Switch package. This one is just slightly more wide and has a slightly rubberized grip on the handle portion. After using both the original and this one, we actually all prefer this model to the other. The grip ends up being far more comfortable and with it being slightly wider it is able to accommodate larger hand sizes more easily. I have smaller hands though and it is equally comfortable in my hands. No issues with responsiveness or durability.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but right Joycon is loose.
customer_reviews.text: The grip and feel of the product is fine, and is comfortable to hold and use. However, the right side joycon is very loose. The left one is alright, and fits snugly without being too tight or too lose. The right side slides out very easily without having to press the button on the back, so much so that even tilting the controller forward can cause it to slide out of the holster. For $7 it's alright, but I definitely would have gotten an official one if they weren't too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Eva J. Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Better than the official one!
customer_reviews.text: This is much more comfortable than the official grip. If I ever need another one, which I don't see happening any time soon, I'd definitely get this before getting the licensed Nintendo one. This is SLIGHTLY wider and has MARGINALLY more full hand grips that really make a huge difference in comfort over long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Shaquille Stoutamire

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality, cool look.
customer_reviews.text: Looks super cool, but PowerA cheaped out on build quality. The box shows metal rails to hold the joycon, and the product has flimsy plastic rails on the final product that the right Joycon pops out of with Joystick use, which kind of defeats the purpose. It's a cool collectors item, but the cheap out on plastic rails makes these "Player 2" peripherals.
customer_reviews.author: Six

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit
customer_reviews.text: Not an official product and it shows. Joy-cons don't fit very well in this unit. On one side, the joy con is loose and rattles around in position. The other side, you have to beat it into place. Getting them out is a headache and I'm constantly worried I'm going to damage the joy cons with the amount of force needed to get them out of the unit. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Morris

customer_reviews.title: It works but...
customer_reviews.text: The rails that the controllers go into are made of plastic instead of metal like the originals. they don’t slide into the controller as well, it’s kind of a tight fit and removing the controllers from the grip is actually more challenging because the release button it’s harder to reach because of the way they designed the back of a grip. I would’ve bought the original Nintendo controller if I had known this but at the same time I thought I was buying a original Nintendo controller because it says Nintendo all over it but it’s not the same
customer_reviews.author: Jonny Goodday

customer_reviews.title: Not a charging grip.  Photo is wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine and has a rubberized grip which I like. My only complaint is that image #6 shows a diagram of the grip plugging into a usb cable, so I assumed that this would allow me to leave the joycons connected and still charge them. I didn't read all of the discription so that is on me, but I do feel like it is misrepresented. I would have spent the extra $4 and bought a grip that lets me pass a charge through if I had realized that this grip didn't have that feature.
customer_reviews.author: hockeyfan333

customer_reviews.title: Quality?
customer_reviews.text: My oldest son bought his younger brothers a Switch. I purchased this to for the extra set of controllers I had to purchase. We've used it for about a month & the left side has a noticeable "bounce" to it that we don't have with the original Nintendo one. It will move slightly on the left side when playing it. Now I always get stuck with it because no one wants to use it. Which means Momma will have to spend more money to buy a new controller grip to replace this one that's a little over a month old & past the Amazon return window. :(
customer_reviews.author: J. Masse

customer_reviews.title: Better than Nintendo's offering
customer_reviews.text: While PowerA usually has subpar products compared to console manufacturer's officially licensed fare, the Joy-Con Comfort Grips for Nintendo Switch have been a great investment and are better than the one that comes with the Switch! The Joy-Cons fit nice and snug into the slots, and the grip texture is much better than the smooth and hard plastic of the one that comes with the console.
customer_reviews.author: Kaznasty

customer_reviews.title: Just Like the Original
customer_reviews.text: These are just like the original. They are a little wider as other have mentioned, but honestly I haven't noticed much of a difference. You cannot really tell. They feel great. The only thing they don't have that the original one does that comes with you Switch is the Nintendo logo. You cannot beat the price either. I got these when they were $10 but normally they are $15 which seems like a steal (since every accessory is so expensive). I got these over the charging grips because the joy cons last long enough for me. I like the feel of these and if you need a grip for you Joy-cons then grab a pair or two of these!
customer_reviews.author: Austin Birrell

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than Nintendo's joycon grip
customer_reviews.text: Plastic guides for the joycons to slide on and off, instead of metal ones like Nintendo has on theirs, make PowerA's grip feel cheap. The joycons don't slide on as nicely as they do with the official grip. That being said, the overall size (slightly larger than Nintendo's) and grip feel OK. The grip is even rubberized, which is something this grip has over Nintendo's grip, if you like that. I can't really recommend this though, because I just can't get over the cheap feeling I get every time I take the joycons on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Hammel

customer_reviews.title: Not a tight fit for controllers
customer_reviews.text: The price on this item was great, however it doesn't hold the joy-con controllers very tight like the actual Nintendo version. This is not a product manufactured by nintendo, only licensed. There is lots of play in the joy-con controllers. For instance, when you press a button or use the joystick, the joy con controller wobbles inside the holder. It can't be rather annoying when trying to do precise movements.
customer_reviews.author: urbantaco

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t notice this wasn’t the stock controller made by Nintendo just in red. It claims it’s a comfort grip and it does have a different soft type wider, fatter grip. But to me it’s a little awkward to hold. It also can’t fit in my case because of its bulk. At 9.99 I’ll just keep it instead of returning it. Maybe it’ll grow on me. The way it’s set up it’s kind of hard to pull the joycons off of the controller.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Lumens

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Tolerances on first unit
customer_reviews.text: I was excited because of all the good reviews for this but the unit I received shouldn't have gotten past QA. The left joycon requires serious force to slide in and out of the grip and I'm afraid it's going to break my left joycon one day. edit: editing this because I got a replacement and there's no problem with the joycons sliding in and out for this one. 4/5 stars only because the edges of the back of the unit get in the way of your index fingers when you use it and it's kind of annoying. I like the stock one better but this one is decent too
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Joy Con holder
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these to allow four players to play on the Switch! They have held up great with lots of play over the past few months. Pros: - built for joy cons - slides easily into base - great price - quality material - feels good in your hand when playing Cons: - None I highly recommend this for anyone needed a comfort grip for their Switch joy cons!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Your joycons will take flight, beware!
customer_reviews.text: Initially the grip got the job done but does not have the durability of the stock Nintendo grip. The right joycon stopped securly clicking when connected and even flew straight towards my TV screen when my son ran towards the TV to get something. Basically your joycons will not stay clicked and secured so beware of this item. I contacted power a and will let you know if they honor their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Works and looks like what you expect
customer_reviews.text: My kids pro controller broke and he can't be playing Super Smash bros on a single joycon because who in the world would do that right!? Those were his words. Anyhow, this works, looks good, has a good snug fit with the joycons, has some texture feel on the back of 2 arms, and overall is a great buy. But most importantly, I won the father of the year award by buying these. Buy it and be in the same club!
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: Schematic incorrect - no charge port on the grip
customer_reviews.text: I bought this over a Pro controller specifically and only for the plug in charger option that the schematic uploaded in the photos clearly states it has. The user guide uploaded by this Official Nintendo Product on this Amazon listing even advises you can plug in the grip as you play. You cannot. There is no charge port in the grip itself. As this is a Christmas present for my kids, I haven't installed everything, but I have no doubt it will work as otherwise advertised. But I'm very annoyed that this is otherwise useless for what I bought it for. I'll be keeping them as backups and buying better controllers for my boys.
customer_reviews.author: J Lo

customer_reviews.title: Issue with the right side
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this grip and I have the same issue with the right side. For some reason no matter what joycon I use (I’ve tested many), the right side disconnects mid game. It doesn’t do that when I’m playing without the grip, so it’s definitely an issue with the grip. Just be aware of this before you purchase as it was an ongoing problem for me from both joycons I purchased on two separate occasions from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Brynn Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Not great. Its not actually bigger than the original joycon ...
customer_reviews.text: Not great. Its not actually bigger than the original joycon grip. Its just wider, but actually slightly shorter. There is also a huge gap between the joycon triggers and the bottom of the grip, which is awkward to hold. Also, the rails are plastic and very prone to sticking when trying to insert or remove the controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Got for my boyfriend, it is exactly as advertised. Came in box in great condition, no dings on corners or anything. Works with his switch handles and is the same look as the holder that came with his switch. My ONLY disappointment was that it does not feel as substantial, in weight and quality, as the one he had gotten with his switch. However, it is much more affordable than the ones sold at the stores, and serves the exact same function. All in all, very happy and it was a much more reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: amm5

customer_reviews.title: Actually better than the OEM Joy Con grips.  Comfort is accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Note: Grey controllers not included, but pictured for reference. I’m also including photos of the Joy Con grips. This feels and works exactly the same as the OEM version. The one thing we liked better with these are the textured grips which ARE very comfortable.. These feel so better than the smooth plastic of the OEM Nintendo grips. I was pleasantly surprised how well these worked. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: PaulH

customer_reviews.title: Short lived
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel of this grip, but the grip no longer holds the joy cons. As you use the grip the joy cons come out of the grip. It's too bad because the feel of how you hold it is fantastic, but there is clearly a reason Nintendo uses metal on their grip at the spot where the joy con connects to the grip instead of plastic. This grip lasted less than 6 months before it no longer held the joy cons securely.
customer_reviews.author: Russell D. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for having multiple players
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this not knowing that a Switch already comes with a grip for the Joy Cons, but I'm glad I did since I'm planning on buying another set of Joy Cons down the road. This grip is comfortable and has a snug fit with the Joy Cons. I do wish that it supported charging, but it's fine that it doesn't since it's easy enough to just slide the Joy Cons back into the console.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Prefer over Nintendo pack in
customer_reviews.text: The handles on this JoyCon grip are larger and feel much better for an adult hand size, and do have a bit of a grip to them. While they're much better than the Nintendo pack in grip it still isn't nearly as good feeling of a controller as the other current consoles. Small gripe but the Joycons do not fit in quite as snug as the pack in grip. I haven't found a better Joycon grip yet and would highly recommend this over the pack in.
customer_reviews.author: Nick B

customer_reviews.title: Lacks the ergonomic design of Nintendo's official Joy-Con grip
customer_reviews.text: Customers need to carefully look that this is actually a different shape than official Joy-Con grip that comes with Switch. While it works just fine when slipping in Joy-Cons and holding them, it's not as comfortable to hold for my fingers. There are square angles that poke my fingers. When I try to slide my Joy-Cons out of the grip, there's barely room for my fingers to hold the release button before taking them out. $10 may be an attractive price for what is basically a piece of plastic shaped to hold smaller controllers, but in my opinion it's not worth it if it's not as comfortable to hold or makes Joy-Con removal a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Tedrich Pam

customer_reviews.title: Left side not secure
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd time I ordered this grip fir my joycons in hopes that the problem with the 1st was an anomaly...WRONG. The both ave the same issue where the left side doesn't hold the joycon securely in place. Whenever you push up on the joycon stick the joycon itself slides out of the grip. The right side locks the right joycon in place as its supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Veteran

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This Joy Con grip works perfectly. And for only $7.50, you can't go wrong! I had contemplated getting the $24 charging grip instead but decided it's not needed. The black one that comes with the Switch isn't rechargeable either.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: It works and easier to use the joycons
customer_reviews.text: My son lost the original grip on a trip, so I replaced it with this one. At first, I was trying to look for another black one to replace the original, or purchase an original, but I was afraid my son would lose another one. The red one turned out looking nice with the black joycons. It's being used everyday since SIP.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnie

customer_reviews.title: Our Son loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Product as advertised and per description. Red color "cool" by our 9 yr old son's statement and liked having color different than the standard black that came with his switch. Feels comfortable in my hands (big hands) when he and I game. Def. worth the money and received in excellent condition and on suggested date by seller!
customer_reviews.author: Brent Bowser

customer_reviews.title: Defective, returned
customer_reviews.text: The left Joy Con controller wouldn’t fit on this item, had to be jammed in to lock into place and was then very difficult to remove. I returned it immediately because I don’t want my actual controllers breaking because of this cheaply made attachment. I would highly suggest not purchasing this, even if you get one that isn’t deffective, they’re still overly bulky and the back is designed in such a way that makes it harder for your index fingers to use the bumpers on top of the Joy Cons.
customer_reviews.author: Mason Beutler

customer_reviews.title: Broke a joycon
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these over a year ago and loved it. This one is not nearly as high in quality. The right joycon is loose and the left is so tight that I couldn’t get a joycon in it at first. I tried it with multiple joycon until I decided to try exerting a bit more pressure which was a mistake. It some how broke the locking mechanism on the joycon. Now when I use that joycon on my switch, it falls off.
customer_reviews.author: Kamae

customer_reviews.title: **Video Review** Great Accessory!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this grip! In my opinion it is better than the official Nintendo brand. Search the title below on YouTube for a quick video. Search on YouTube: PowerA Joy-Con Comfort Grip Nintendo Switch Review - My2Cents
customer_reviews.author: My2Cents

customer_reviews.title: Official Nintendo control handle
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid, inexpensive, colorful dual control handle that works like a champ. Some people say it's not metal like the black one that comes with Switch system, but it works just as well and has non-slip grips for hands. We've been using it extensively for 3 months and it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hermann

customer_reviews.title: ALMOST official
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a fine product, but my wife and son didn't care for the feel of it; the back side of the grips is blunted at the top instead of rounded like the official Nintendo grips, so the index fingers rest awkwardly on it. I also noticed that the slot for the left joy-con is a little tight, but it does fit. There's nothing inherently wrong with this product, but I'd be inclined to pay a couple more bucks for the Nintendo-made one in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the last listing picture
customer_reviews.text: Well I was really stoked to get this at first. When I got it in the mail the first thing I did was popped it open and threw my joy cons in to start playing, since I bought my switch second hand and didn’t get the grips. I was confused when I didn’t see a charging cord because the listing clearly says you can charge the joy cons with this grip with the pictures. Later saw that it was just the grip without that functionality. That’s the only reason I’m giving it 3/5 because it was mislabeled and feel like I’m missing out on a function a thought I paid money for.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: More grip and Comfort than standard Switch Grip
customer_reviews.text: I tried out a friend's to see the difference... It does changes the way your grip handles the joycons, it's not as smooth as the Standard Switch grip, it actually has a textured rubber-like feeling so it doesn't slip. It's more ergonomic and doesn't tire your wrists at all, still please rest after more than 2 hours of constantly playing to avoid injuries
customer_reviews.author: Guille Rodríguez

customer_reviews.title: Left side tight, right side loose
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, but like I saw in other reviews, the fit for the controller on the left is overly tight, and it's so loose on the right side that the controller moves a little bit. You don't notice this when you're playing, but it's odd. Whether you prefer this to the size/shape of the Nintendo brand is a matter of choice.
customer_reviews.author: SilverSurfer

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: it works. its not terrible whatsoever. compared to the one that come with the switch, it has some weird lip that makes it a bit harder to release the joycons. my only reason for disregarding that completely is i have yet to realize the benefit of a slightly different design. it works and its worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Frank D

customer_reviews.title: exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: the joy cons fit perfectly in the comfort grip. maybe I got a newer version because I had no problems at all with them getting stuck. they stay locked in until you release them with the buttons on the controller on the backs. it is very comfortable to hold and made of a matte plastic material.
customer_reviews.author: Amazin

customer_reviews.title: works fine, but doesn't feel as nice as the Nintendo branded one
customer_reviews.text: comparing this to the one that comes with the switch, this one feels cheaper, the grip isn't as soft, and it doesn't feel as solid. It works just fine though, and aligns with the controllers and everything, but if you're looking for a high quality feel, stick with the Nintendo branded one. the price does make it worth it though...
customer_reviews.author: Lukas Rudis

customer_reviews.title: Good but not quite great as second joy con grip.
customer_reviews.text: Not the same size as the real Nintendo grip, slightly larger, but the LEDS function and it works and is a bit cheaper so I guess I shouldn't complain. I just thought it was Nintendos unit because I didn't realize it was simply a licensed product. So be an informed buyer, if you realize it is not the exact same unit you will probably be fine. The thing that makes it not great so far is possibly we haven't used it enough to make sliding the joy cons on and off easier and smooth like they are on the original grip.
customer_reviews.author: NRHJohn

customer_reviews.title: An improvement on the Nintendo brand grips
customer_reviews.text: It takes the ease of use that Nintendo's grips have and make them better by flaring out the handles a bit for extra comfort, and adding a grippy material to the back. I actually prefer this to the one I received with my Switch. You know when we were kids and a friend came over to play? You always gave that kid the off-brand controller, like some MadCatz with 100 buttons and a cup holder. Well now I'll keep this comfort grip for myself and my guest can use my Nintendo brand grip with the basic design and no finger grips.
customer_reviews.author: MC2

customer_reviews.title: Broken. Barely worked
customer_reviews.text: This product works but is deceiving because the advertising clearly displays a Nintendo logo as if it's an official accessory. Aside from that, it works alright, but one side is much tighter to lock the joycon in so it makes it difficult to remove the controller. *Update- the right side just doesn't hold the joycon anymore. It constantly slides out of place and is almost useless.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Nice Alternative to the Official Nintendo Controller
customer_reviews.text: The good: - Impressed with the overall build quality - Easy to snap in-and-out the joy cons - The rubberized grips are much better than the official Nintendo controller The bad: - No metal slides for the joy cons - a bit larger than the official Nintendo controller
customer_reviews.author: Paul Michael Krieg

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the product instructions page in photos!
customer_reviews.text: The product was not the same one in the sample pictures. I really like how comfortable the grips are in my hand and how much more grip I have. I wish I would've gotten a different one. I plan on keeping it to have around for guests, but I am a little disappointed. Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jake moua

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Overall it works, however I have not tested it for long term. 4/5 stars due to some minor flaws in my opinion. 1. The rails are plastic not metal. 2. the left side is a tight fit and you have to be careful when sliding the joy cons in and out. 3. "This one isn't really a complaint, but rather just something to take note of." It is slightly wider than the official one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, easy to use but sticks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product a few weeks ago and was pleased to find that it fit perfectly and comfortably into my hands (I am a 5'3 small person, so I'm not sure how much this would apply to a larger person). It seems sturdy, doesn't have the appearance of something that was cheaply made (despite the great price!) but the only bad thing about this product is that on one side, the joy con will stick, making it difficult to pull out of the controller. The other side doesn't have any issues. Not a huge issue but it's a deficit nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Briella Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Solid quality third-party grip
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Reflectors for seeing indicators on Joycon. - Solid quality. Cons: - Glossy, textured black finish, rather than the nice matte black of the grip that comes with the Switch console. - Left Joycon slot very tight, but manageable. Other: - The grip is slightly different than the one that comes with the Switch. The handles on this are slightly shorter, but slightly wider. But still feels fine in my hands all the same. Overall score: 3/5, average.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the money
customer_reviews.text: Works great but is not standard nintendo size. It has been slightly modified and has a bigger middle area between joycons. This created a tighter fit for the joycons and they did not slide in easily. Also, my kids like to put their "skins" on to know which one is theirs and the skins do not fit on these aftermarket controllers so it was disappointing. Other than that, decent for the price I paid for it and serves its purpose as an extra handheld.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Kruger

customer_reviews.title: Buy the nintendo brand
customer_reviews.text: The price was half of the nintendo brand, BUT it has plastic slots on the side rather than metal. It broke after just over a month of low usage. The joycon now slides out of the channel during gameplay. By low usage we play super smash bro at lunch at work for about 30min every weekday and we never slide the controllers out more than 5x.
customer_reviews.author: Parzival

customer_reviews.title: An Unexpected DIY Project
customer_reviews.text: When this came in my wife tried it out to see if the controllers were held tight. To her disaopointment, the controllers wouldn't even slide in. Once I got home I thought some thing didn't look right. The rails didn't appear to be opened in either end and the lights on the controller wouldn't align with the grip. I found that the front plate was on upside down. Luckily I had an eyeglass repair kit with a screwdriver that was small enough to unscrew the six screws and flip the bezel. Once I corrected this, everything fit and was snug.
customer_reviews.author: A. Miller

customer_reviews.title: ZL and ZR
customer_reviews.text: It’s cheaper because it’s all plastic to include the rails where the controllers slide in place which is fine. My one complaint is that when you hold it you’re inclined to rest your fore fingers on the controller and sometimes makes it confusing when I’m trying to use ZL or ZR.
customer_reviews.author: Lada

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as Official Nintendo, but Color doesn't match Joy-cons
customer_reviews.text: The grip is very similar to the official Nintendo grip. There's a rubberized grip on the back that makes it a little easier to hold and it feels a little more sturdy than the official Nintendo. However, I purposely purchased the red color because I wanted it with my red joycons. As you can tell by the pictures, the grip is a little darker red. So that's why I knocked it off a star.
customer_reviews.author: Keeney

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old says these are a must have for the small joycons. I need this if I'm playing with him beaus I don't like using the joycons, I like using the regular controllers. You just take the joycon and slide it into the controller. And then it works as a regular controller. Great to have for the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Good Grips, Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: I went back and forth on if I wanted to purchase the Nintendo, more, expensive version of these. I chose to go with these since they had good reviews. Not disappointed. I use this with my 2nd set of joy cons I got that only get used when I have more people to play with. I can't charge them in this grip but with long they can go between charges with low use I don't mind having to take them off and switch them out on the cradle to get them charged.
customer_reviews.author: Reason

customer_reviews.title: better than the Nintendo brand one
customer_reviews.text: This Joycon holder is half the price of the Nintendo brand one I got. It's a better product. The hand holding "wings" are a tad larger, and have rubber grip to help when hands get sweaty. For half the price of the Nintendo one, it's a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: onlineshoplover

customer_reviews.title: Left joycon won’t slide in
customer_reviews.text: I received this about a day ago because I like the red color and needed another grip and because it’s from Nintendo, I expected nothing but the best obviously... BUT the left side where you slide the left joycon in is not going all the way in to connect. It doesn’t look bent or anything but it won’t go in without me forcing it and I don’t want to force it too much for obvious reasons. Disappointed for sure but I like the color.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Extra Grip For Joy-Cons!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a cheap grip for my additional Joy-Cons and this does the trick! I don't play with 4 players a lot so this is mostly used for guests. Yes it is a 3rd party grip, but for 1/3 of the price it is well worth it and basically just holds the joy-cons. Very comfortable and great for multi-player games! Please click the "Helpful" button below if you read this review!
customer_reviews.author: Casey JonesTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: The color isn't as shown. I wanted it to match my Mario red joycons but I feel this would better match the neon red joycons. It's also bigger in size than the original Nintendo black comfort grip. Cheaper in quality too, but it does the job I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like this one more than the Original one that comes with the box
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my extra pair of joy-cons and when I have to use only one set, I prefer these for the hand grip and access in general as it feels much better to hold compared to the original one. Nintendo licensed and the reviews helped with the purchase and I am happy about it
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: Meh It's $9.99
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done for $9.99. No metal track where the Joycons slide into, unlike the original. It has some weird flange on the back my the bottom bumper buttons. Then after a few days I noticed while playing the plastic makes a weird crackling noise while gripping it. I have heavy hands. But the original one doesn't do that.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Great pricing! Don’t hesitate to buy
customer_reviews.text: Works really well with my joycons! I got these so my boyfriend and I could play animal crossing on the same console and it works perfectly for easy games like this.. I’m not sure how well I would like it for more intense games but it gets the job done for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Burton

customer_reviews.title: works but quality not as good as original
customer_reviews.text: works as Nintendo comfort grip but the feel quality definitely is not as good... the rubberized handle covers scratches easily... mine came with a deep gouge straight out of the box. otherwise, it does work..
customer_reviews.author: E.C.

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold controllers securely
customer_reviews.text: After having this product for less then 2 months it does not hold the joycons securely. The controllers will slip out while playing. Compared to the OEM holder this one uses plastic instead of metal tabs to hold the controller and it just does not lock in securely. Buy OEM or look elsewhere, this handle is already junk after less then 5 hours of total use.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for my extra joy cons
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for over a year. They are great. The rubber grips on the back give you a better feel than the stock joy cons. Definitely recommend these, especially if you have extra joy cons. The price makes it even better!
customer_reviews.author: McKay

customer_reviews.title: Good but with one caveat
customer_reviews.text: Probably like a lot of people, I bought this because it was half the price of Nintendo's. It worked well for awhile, but eventually would not lock the joy-cons in. Part of the issue was the joy-cons' plastic lock buckles, which I replaced with metal versions. However, the PowerA grip has plastic rails that eventually would not lock the joy-cons in place, whereas the Nintendo version has metal rails that keep them from sliding out. So, this grip is good, but you might eventually need to replace sooner than you would Nintendo's grip.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gol

customer_reviews.title: It looks and feels like a cheap toy
customer_reviews.text: This product may have been officially licensed. But it's nowhere near as nice as the one that originally came with my Switch. It has these broad and obvious plastic seams. It feels cheap, not a great playing experience when I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Villanueva

customer_reviews.title: Did not realize that while this is a licensed Nintendo ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not realize that while this is a licensed Nintendo product, it's made by a third party (visible on the bottom right of the box). That's not a problem functionally, but if you buy a skin that's sized for a Joy-Con with comfort grip, it won't fit this one!
customer_reviews.author: L. Tolis

customer_reviews.title: Great texture feel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because we have 2 sets of Joy-Cons and 2 pro controllers, with this now we have 4 full feeling controllers. Everyone in my family likes the texture feel of the grips, it's worth the $9 or whatever I paid for this.
customer_reviews.author: K. Galloway

customer_reviews.title: color is off
customer_reviews.text: the red is off compared to the red japan version joy cons as you can see there is a balance to this i liked and dont like the back grip con feels like there could be a third trigger pro the bulk and rubbery feel and the color being off is another con gave it four stars because it is better the the grip that comes with your switch
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: It's okay.
customer_reviews.text: The controller itself is nicely shaped, however I do not like the fact that the joy-cons do not "lock" into this unlike the controller adapter that comes with the switch itself. I've had some issues during gameplay where the joy-con controllers try to slide up and out of the holder. The quality of the material is nice, it feels better in your hands than the original adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Anna

customer_reviews.title: Nice and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Product came in a very similar looking box to the original which was a nice touch, enjoying the rubber on the handles for better grip (and to aid sweaty hands) enjoying this so far and have had no issues with it
customer_reviews.author: Moni IBNZ

customer_reviews.title: Not Nintendo branded, but a decent replica.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect from a third-party controller but since it only holds the actual controllers I figured why not. I has a gripped section instead of the all smooth plastic like the Nintendo Joy-Con. There's also little notches near the triggers and aren't terrible but I still prefer the original. Also, those changes make it a little more difficult to remove the controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Ben C

customer_reviews.title: Great controller and grip
customer_reviews.text: First off this was a fast shipment so that’s a plus. The controller worked great esp the grip. Me and my kids tested it out and they love this controller because of the grip and easier to play game vs just two separate pieces. Definitely will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Linda V.

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: okay this is very nice to use as it is bigger then just the small one handle controller plus the colors are great for kids that want to tell apart who gets what handle. Also I (as the parent) use my own un-cootied from sticky kids hands
customer_reviews.author: Sherri O.

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: These are immensely better than the default joycon grip that comes with the standard Switch. For the price, I would recommend these to any Switch owner. Cost friendly, and improves upon the original joycon grip design.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Garcia

customer_reviews.title: A little better than the official one
customer_reviews.text: My kids like the red and then it has a little bit of grip to it that the one that comes with the Switch does not have. They usually have to take turns getting to use this one to the point where for this price I should just buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Kizer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for gameplay
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Great grip for when you're playing combat games so you don't slide around. Feels new after being a PS4 controller person, but it's a great product. Nintendo licensed and everything too!
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Standard grip
customer_reviews.text: Very basic and does what it says. The joy con are loose when attached so dont expect a very tight locked in fit like the grip that comes with the switch. Overall, it works and doesn't negatively impact gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plastic rails and it clashes with red Joy-Cons
customer_reviews.text: (This is specifically for the red grip. The others may be different.) 1. The Joy-Con grip that comes with the Switch has metal tracks that connect to the Joy-Cons. This one has plastic tracks that feel and look cheaper. Maybe they'll stand up just as well in the long run, but I'll have to see. 2. The red of this grip DOES NOT match the red Joy-Cons that are available to buy. They clash pretty badly. The grip does look okay with the gray/black Joy-Cons, so it's not a complete loss.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Needed an extra!
customer_reviews.text: I needed an extra one of these every since moving in with my boyfriend. Now that 2 people play with the switch and sometimes we want to play together, it was a no brainer. Works very well and great price!
customer_reviews.author: MaryC22

customer_reviews.title: Color is off
customer_reviews.text: The photos make it look like a Mario Red, but it's more of a Neon Red/orange (not like the Red/Blue Neon controllers.) I returned for color mismatch and how the Joy-cons did not slide in easily.
customer_reviews.author: Christina H

customer_reviews.title: Tried two - neither was good quality
customer_reviews.text: The joy cons get stuck in the grips, making it hard to get them in/out. Exchanged the first one, but ended up returning the second one as well. I had better luck buying the real Nintendo comfort grips used on eBay for $7.
customer_reviews.author: Dayzdays

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as original
customer_reviews.text: Price is great and they work exactly as the original that came with the system. Great for one or two players for games such as Mario Kart where the tiny controllers quickly get uncomfortable. Highly recommended for the price.
customer_reviews.author: RTM

customer_reviews.title: Good j-con controller
customer_reviews.text: Good j-con, the cons are that when sliding in the controllers the j-con does not have the metal slide brackets and is made in plastic. This will deteriorate quick, otherwise a good temporary solution.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great Grip!!!
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than the one included with the Switch system, great for tinier hands. Textured grip is just enough to keep the controller solidly in your hand, better than stock smooth grips My wife prefers this grip over the stick Switch one included with the system
customer_reviews.author: MANIMAL

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable - but slightly uneven sides on 3rd pair?
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 pairs for my boyfriend in December 2018. He like them a lot and hasn't complained. I bought another two months ago (June 2019) and the left side seems to be a little tighter than the right. It's hard to get the controller in and out of the left side. But once they're in, I don't have any problems. The first 2 I ordered are good. I'd probably buy these again if I needed a fourth. They seem to be just lightly bigger then the one that came with the switch. The grip is also a little more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie

customer_reviews.title: Does not match the Neon Red Joy-Cons that come with the switch.
customer_reviews.text: The red of this is not the same red used in the standard neon-red joycon that comes with the system. It may match other joycons but I don't have any of those to compare against. I found the black back running more annoying than nice, and it extends just a bit past the ZL and ZR buttons, it's a bit annoying personally but it never got in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip L. Gooch

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for your joy cons
customer_reviews.text: Exact replacement for the one I got with my switch years ago and the kids have since lost. There are better controllers on the market for if you want to leverage the ones that come with switch as a detached controller, this gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: LLC

customer_reviews.title: Worth the low price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to have an extra grip for the joy cons. I like the grip and feel and the size. My only complaint is the gap between the back of the control and the trigger buttons.. seems weird compared to the original model.
customer_reviews.author: Beaner

product_meta.title: PowerA Joy Con Comfort Grips for Nintendo Switch - Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackHow to setup: Align the left Joy-Con controllers with the left rail of the Joy-Con Comfort Grip making sure the Minus symbol is at the top. Slide the Joy-Con controller all the way down until you see the player indicator light turn on. Repeat for the right Joy-Con controller.
feature_bullets: Lightweight, ergonomic design for comfortable gameplay anywhere
Double injected rubber grips for added comfort
Easy slide in design secures each Joy Con
Visible player indicator lights; Protective Qualities: Shock resistant
Officially licensed by Nintendo for Nintendo Switch

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars7,082 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
